arm_group.description: 1,5 L of 1,5% UHT milk pr day for 3 weeks (21days)
1,5 L 1,5% pasteurised milk pr day for 3 weeks (21 days)

brief_summary.textblock:
The studie are to investigate the effect of ultra heat treated (UHT) versus pasteurised milk
      on bloodlipid profile

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of UHT Treated Milk on Blolipid Profile
clinical_study.condition: To Investigate the Effect of UHT Treated Milk Versus Pasteurised Milk on Bloodlipid Profil

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy men and women

          -  22-50 years of age

          -  BMI 25-30

          -  non smokers

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  lactose intolerance

          -  milk allergy or other types of food allergy

          -  Intestinal, abdominal or endocrinnologic diseases

          -  daily use of dietary supplements incl. vitamins and minerals

          -  cronic diseases (diabetes, CVD etc.)

          -  user of medicin on perscription that can influence the resuts of the study

          -  allergic to paraamino benzoe acid

          -  Physical activity > 10 h pr week

          -  Blood donor

          -  on a diet or change of dietary habits within 3 months

          -  body weigh change > 3 kg within the last 3 month

          -  special diets

          -  concomitant participation on other studies

          -  not able to comply with protocol

facility.name: Department of Nutrition, Exercise and Sports

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of UHT Treated Milk on Blolipid Profile

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Ethical Comitee of Copenhagen

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
